Line 372: Line 372:
== Response ==
== Response ==
â
Ubuntu's popularity has climbed steadily since the software's release in 2004. Ubuntu has been the most viewed Linux distribution on [[DistroWatch|Distrowatch.com]] three years running, including 2005,<ref name="distro05" /> 2006,<ref name="distro06" /> 2007<ref name="distro07" /> and is currently the most viewed for 2008.<ref name="distro08">{{cite web|url=http://distrowatch.com/index.php?dataspan=26|title=distrowatch.com/index.php?dataspan=26<!-- INSERT TITLE -->|accessdate=2008-06-13}}</ref> Google searches for "Ubuntu" have been steadily climbing since 2004, while searches have been shrinking or plateauing for terms related to other major desktop Linux distributions such as "[[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]]", "[[Debian]]" or "[[SUSE Linux|SUSE]]" over the same period.<ref>[[Google Trends]], comparing [http://www.google.com/trends?q=Fedora|RHEL|Red+Hat,+Debian,+Ubuntu,+SUSE|OpenSUSE,+Mandrake|Mandriva&ctab=0&geo=all&date=all&sort=2 Fedora/RHEL/Red Hat, Debian, Ubuntu, SUSE/OpenSUSE, Mandrake/Mandriva], accessed on [[2008-06-13]]</ref> In an August 2007 survey of 38,500 visitors on DesktopLinux.com, Ubuntu was the most popular distribution with 30.3% of respondents claiming to use it.<ref name="Market Survey 2007" />
+
Ubuntu's popularity has climbed steadily since the software's release in 2004. Ubuntu has been the most viewed Linux distribution on [[DistroWatch|Distrowatch.com]] three years running, including 2005,<ref name="distro05" /> 2006,<ref name="distro06" /> 2007<ref name="distro07" /> and is currently the most viewed for 2008.<ref name="distro08">{{cite web|url=http://distrowatch.com/index.php?dataspan=26|title=distrowatch.com/index.php?dataspan=26<!-- INSERT TITLE -->|accessdate=2008-06-13}}</ref> Google searches for "Ubuntu" have been steadily climbing since 2004, while searches have been shrinking or plateauing for terms related to other major desktop Linux distributions such as "[[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]]", "[[Debian]]" or "[[SUSE Linux|SUSE]]" over the same period.<ref>[[Google Trends]], comparing [http://www.google.com/trends?q=Fedora|RHEL|Red+Hat,+Debian,+Ubuntu,+SUSE|OpenSUSE,+Mandrake|Mandriva&ctab=0&geo=all&date=all&sort=2 Fedora/RHEL/Red Hat, Debian, Ubuntu, SUSE/OpenSUSE, Mandrake/Mandriva], accessed on [[2008-06-13]]</ref> In an August 2007 survey of 38,500 visitors on DesktopLinux.com, Ubuntu was the most popular distribution with 30.3% of respondents claiming to use it.<ref name="Market Survey 2007" />
Ubuntu was awarded the Reader Award for best Linux distribution at the 2005 [[LinuxWorld Conference and Expo]] in London,<ref>{{cite web | url=http://w3.linux-magazine.com/issue/61/Linuxworld_London_UK_2005.pdf| title=LinuxWorld Expo UK 2005 | format=PDF | accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref> has been favorably reviewed in online and print publications,<ref>{{Cite web| url=http://www.reviewlinux.com/index.php/?m=show&id=39| title=Ubuntu - A New Approach to Desktop Linux| accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web | url=http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/8253| title=Linux in Government: Linux Desktop Reviews, Part 6 - Ubuntu| accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{Citation| last=McAllister| first=Neil| publication-date=January 2008| title=Gutsy Gibbon: Desktop Linux OS Made Easy| periodical=PC World| volume=26| issue=1| pages=84| url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/138884/first_look_ubuntu_710_desktop_linux.html| accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref> and has won [[InfoWorld]]'s 2007 Bossie Award for ''Best Open Source Client OS''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.infoworld.com/article/07/09/10/37FE-boss-platforms_1.html|title=Best of open source in platforms and middleware|accessdate=2008-06-13}}</ref>
Ubuntu was awarded the Reader Award for best Linux distribution at the 2005 [[LinuxWorld Conference and Expo]] in London,<ref>{{cite web | url=http://w3.linux-magazine.com/issue/61/Linuxworld_London_UK_2005.pdf| title=LinuxWorld Expo UK 2005 | format=PDF | accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref> has been favorably reviewed in online and print publications,<ref>{{Cite web| url=http://www.reviewlinux.com/index.php/?m=show&id=39| title=Ubuntu - A New Approach to Desktop Linux| accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web | url=http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/8253| title=Linux in Government: Linux Desktop Reviews, Part 6 - Ubuntu| accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{Citation| last=McAllister| first=Neil| publication-date=January 2008| title=Gutsy Gibbon: Desktop Linux OS Made Easy| periodical=PC World| volume=26| issue=1| pages=84| url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/138884/first_look_ubuntu_710_desktop_linux.html| accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref> and has won [[InfoWorld]]'s 2007 Bossie Award for ''Best Open Source Client OS''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.infoworld.com/article/07/09/10/37FE-boss-platforms_1.html|title=Best of open source in platforms and middleware|accessdate=2008-06-13}}</ref>
